# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Hereâ€™s a function in Julia that wraps a string based on a specified `text_width`:

```julia
function wrap_string(input_string::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    words = split(input_string)
    wrapped_lines = ""
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            wrapped_lines *= current_line * "\n"
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= (current_line == "" ? "" : " ") * word
        end
    end

    return wrapped_lines * current_line  # Append any remaining text
end

# Example usage
text = "This is an example string to demonstrate the wrapping function."
wrapped = wrap_string(text, 10)
println(wrapped)
```

The function ensures that no line exceeds the specified width of 10 characters.
